intro: Virecta fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered vireya, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its dense, clustered growth habit and glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, typically blooming in the spring. Virecta fasciculata thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens and greenhouses due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability.
